content_html:
Company Description

It's an exciting time to be part of Open Universities Australia (OUA) – Australia’s destination for online tertiary study. As a not-for-profit, we empower students from all walks of life by helping them achieve their goals and transforming their lives through access to education from universities across the country.


Job Description

We are on an exciting journey to be the best online marketplace for higher education. As part of this we have an exciting engineering strategy to transform our underlying architecture. We have an opportunity for an Engineering Lead to join one of our cross functional teams to help us continue improving the experiences of our students and university partners, and help inform and execute our engineering strategy.

As an Engineering Lead, you will be provide technical leadership to one of our cross functional teams and you will be responsible for co-designing, implementing and maintaining OUA's web based systems in a collaborative team environment. You will collaborate with Product Managers to understand requirements and develop solutions that meet the needs of customers. You will liaise with the Chief Engineer and other Engineering Leads to ensure that solutions are in line with OUA's technical vision.

You will provide leadership, guidance and patterns in the implementation of solutions using a variety of programming languages, databases and cloud technologies. You will champion technical practices to ensure high quality outcome for our business.

As an Engineering Lead your accountabilities will include:

  • Provide technical thought leadership – Draw on your broad experience to seed new thinking into our teams, challenging the norm and establish best practice.
  • Facilitation of technical decision making – Guiding teams and individuals toward making decisions that is aligned with OUA’s technical vision and principles.
  • Coaching and mentorship – Supporting other engineering team members to develop their skills by modelling behaviour, giving feedback, sharing knowledge and regular one on ones
  • Leading people – Lead the team that you are in, the individuals that reports into you and by being a member of the Engineering Trade leadership.
  • Active contributor – Be involved in the day to day work – write code, review PRs, technical analysis, etc.
  • Contribute to the overall technical vision – Help with setting, rolling out and aligning to the OUA technical vision.
  • Support early stage discovery – Engage in the discovery, analysis, design and breakdown of early stage initiatives.

Qualifications
  • Capable of coaching and leading a development team and software developers in all aspects of agile software development.
  • Experience in software product development using at least one of the following languages - JavaScript (React.JS, Node.JS, TypeScript), Java (or other JVM languages), C#
  • Experience in web architecture patterns and conventions, for example micro services, API design, contract testing, containerisation, test automation and serverless architecture.
  • Experience in modern software development techniques such as test driven development, refactoring, deployment automation, DevOps and CI/CD.
    Experience with cloud computing services (AWS) and associated technologies
  • Experience working with Sitecore or Salesforce is a bonus.

Additional Information

You will part of a cross functional product development team that is responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining OUA’s web based systems in a collaborative team environment. You will collaborate with members of your product development team to understand requirements and develop solutions that meet the needs of customers. You will liaise with the Engineering Leads to ensure that solutions are in line with OUA’s technical vision.

content_html:
EBSCO research databases, ebooks, and library technologies are the most-used, premium online information resources for tens of thousands of institutions worldwide, representing millions of end-users.

The Opportunity

Software Engineer Consultant is the primary technical advisor and product advocate for the regional Sales team and key customers; responsible for UI customisations and extensions, API integration, and small app development.

What we offer

  • The role has extensive variety in tasks with no two days the same.
  • We have a great team, and this is a terrific opportunity to join EBSCO working from your home office yet communicating with many of our team and customers.
  • You will attend pre-sales consultations with our sales team, providing technical information to IT teams and end users.
  • Flexibility regarding working hours is provided to suit business demands and maintain work/life balance.
  • The role provides scope for further skill development.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Regional/Market (Oceania) authoritative expert on technology aspects of EBSCO’s Software as a Service (SaaS) platform functionality, competition, trends.
  • Conduct pre-sales presentations (to small and large audiences) and clear written responses to Requests for Information (RFI) or related inquiries.
  • Contribute to automation and integration processes at varying levels: customer requirements definition, coding, testing, documentation and management.

Required Qualifications

  • College/University bachelor Degree. Masters qualification preferred.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience and excellence in either System Librarianship, Consulting, Product Management, or related field.
  • 2 plus years' experience with jQuery, React.js, PHP, Node.js based full stack development.
  • 1 plus years' experience working on AWS or Azure or other IaaS providers.
  • Ability to travel approximately 50% to national and international locations.

Preferred Experience

  • 2 plus years’ experience installing, configuring and maintaining applications on Windows and Linux platforms.
  • 1 plus years’ experience designing solutions using serverless technologies.
  • 1 plus years’ experience working with:
  • Online research database platforms (e.g. EBSCOhost)
  • Integrated Library Systems (ILS e.g. Alma, Millennium, Sierra, Symphony, Koha)
  • Institutional Repository platforms (e.g. ContentDM, DSpace, Fedora)
  • Content Management / Search software (e.g. Sharepoint, Drupal, VuFind)
  • Experience programming with APIs, ETL data files (e.g. MARC, XML, JSON), and Agile methodologies.

We are seeking a candidate with the technical experience and the required personal skills to communicate and build relationships with our customers and the sales team.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $115,000.00 to $125,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • programming: 2 years (Required)
  • System Librarian: 2 years (Preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor Degree (Required)

Work Eligibility:

  • The candidate can work permanently with no restriction on hours (Required)

Work Remotely:

  • Yes

content_html:
• Minimum of eight (8) years of experience assisting at the executive level in a fast-paced environment.
  • Superior knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, and SharePoint are desired.
  • High levels of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information and dealing with people.
  • Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.

Here at Amazon Web Services we're looking for an exceptionally bright, experienced, energetic and self-motivated Executive Assistant to support one of our Sales Directors.

This exciting role requires superior attention to detail, the ability to meet tight deadlines, great organizational skills, and the ability to juggle multiple critical requests. A high level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information, and professionalism in dealing with senior professionals inside and outside the company is critical, as is a good sense of humor.

As the successful candidate you will apply your many years of executive support experience to complete complex tasks and projects quickly with little to no guidance, react with appropriate urgency to situations that require a quick turnaround, switch gears at a moment's notice, and take effective action without having to know the total picture. The need to engage external customers will be frequent so previous experience supporting a sales or professional services team will stand you in good stead.

More broadly, your responsibilities will include management of complex calendar and scheduling requirements; acting as a liaison for the leadership team; driving key team activities (such as staff meeting agendas, space planning) and travel coordination. And we mustn't forget - have fun at work and help others do the same. To be considered you must possess extensive experience assisting at the executive level in a fast-paced environment which has equipped you with the skills to "look around corners"; superior knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, and SharePoint as well as exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills..

We're a fast growing business and whilst the role will be demanding and we face new challenges every day there is a strong sense of team. If this is the environment you excel in this could be the role for you


  • Detailed planning, time management and organizational skills are required.
  • Positive, proactive and able to always exercise great judgment.
  • Ability to work in a highly ambiguous environment.
  • Experience in a complex corporate organization
  • Experience supporting Leadership Teams within a client driven / sales organization
  • Experience in building processes and mechanisms to simplify operational cadence within a Leadership Team and across organization
#AWSANZ

FinXL IT Professional Services is an innovative Australian owned company providing our clients with technology enabled business solutions and consulting services.The Finite group is a multi-award winning consultancy recognised across Australia and New Zealand for excellence in recruitment for the technology consultancy space. Our teams specialise in the following areas of technology recruitment (contract and permanent): DevOps | Business Intelligence | Big Data | Analytics | Infrastructure | Engineering | Digital; iOS Android| Front End Development| Back End Development | UX | UI | Research | Project Management | Change Management | AdOps | Service Delivery |

  • Solid experience working within Frontend Development (HTML5, CSS3, ES6 JavaScript)

  • Experience in a CI/CG environment and with tools such as Git / Github / Bitbucket
If you feel like this is the role for you, please APPLY now!
Please note: Due to the expected volume of applications, only shortlisted persons will be notified

• 6 months Contract with a view to extend
  • Location : Melbourne
  • Azure, React, Angular
Our client is looking for an experienced UI Engineer who will provide technical expertise and leadership in web application development through advanced knowledge and skills in web technologies. These skills would include an in-depth knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular and/or VueJS, and other related technologies, libraries and build systems.

Key Skills required:
  • Strong JavaScript, ES6 and/or 2015.
  • Strong React (preferred), Angular and/or VueJS experience.
  • Strong HTML5 and DOM knowledge.
  • CSS experience using a pre-processor (Sass or Less).
  • Experience implementing responsive web designs across multiple device form factors.
  • Knowledge of web browser APIs.
  • Good understanding of Git and GitFlow.
  • Good understanding of Webpack and other development tools and build systems (e.g. Babel, Gulp, Karma, Yarn, NPM, Node.js, Jest).
  • Strong developer testing skills (unit testing through to system testing for continuous integration).
  • Understanding of secure and defensive coding practices, especially the OWASP Top 10 risks.
  • (Desirable) Experience with Azure pipelines and Azure configuration in general.
  • (Desirable) Experience with composite UIs, micro frontends and/or web components.
  • (Desirable) GraphQL experience.
  • (Desirable) React Native experience.
  • (Desirable) Experience with IP networking, common network components and common internet protocols
To be considered for this great opportunity “Apply Now" or contact Manasa - manasabr@horizonconsulting.com.au
3128878

content_html:
• Melbourne CBD
  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Leading global cloud computing vendor!

Be a part of a leading global vendor and a high performing team as an AI/ML Specialist Solution Architect.

Located in the Melbourne CBD, you will be assigned on a permanent basis and be exposed to the latest and greatest cloud technologies.

About the role:
You will work with a diverse portfolio of clients across platforms and industries in Australia and New Zealand. This is a very hands-on role where you will manage clients concurrently, acting as trusted advisors to help drive growth and strategy through AI/ML solutions.

Travel is required between the Melbourne and Sydney offices every couple of months with international travel 4 times a year. You will spend the majority of the time customer-facing but will be doing the development of POCs and training.

You will have;
  • Very strong understanding and experience in the field of AI and related technologies.
  • A wide breadth of technical knowledge but a deep understanding and depth of a subdomain like deep learning, computer vision, NLP)
  • Experience building and deploying ML models into production. Significant experience with full life cycle deployment of AI solutions and passion for getting hands dirty with code.
  • Experience using Cloud Computing Technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Strong technical architecture, design, deployment and operational level knowledge of AI platforms, standards, protocols and devices
  • Strong experience with software development in languages like C, C++, NodeJS / Javascript, Python.
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must
  • Strong stakeholder management and experience working with C-suite executives down to a tech team. This
  • Ph.D. or Advanced Degree in related technology
If you think you are suitable for the role, please click apply. Alternatively, please email Jessica Raj for more information (jessica.raj@graniteconsulting.com.au)

content_html:
You likely know by now that affix is all for working with ambitious companies made up of talented people who are driven by making a difference and changing things for the better. And this company my friend no exception!

In its fourth year, Curio is a fast-growing education company that is driven by their curiosity, creativity and dedication to improving our world through education (most of this online). Established in 2016, they have scaled to nearly 80 people, with offices in London, Sydney and Melbourne but a global presence through their remote working philosophy. They have a diverse range of capabilities covering management consulting, higher education, strategy, research, product development, and learning & service design.

The company was founded by David Bowser, a neuroscience researcher who has a long history of consulting to clients in highly regulated sectors including education, financial services and healthcare specialising in strategy, marketing, product development, and organisational change engagements. He is still hands on, and has created a very inclusive and innovative environment for his teams to be able to experiment with ideas that inspire positive change.

The Role:
The Curio Product Team needs a Tech Lead to own technical leadership and work on its digital products. This is a role that intersects being a technical leader, an architect, whilst still being happy to jump on the tools as a developer.
They need someone who has full-stack skills, and can think through how to architect their products so they can scale, as well as how to best build out beautiful front-end designs.

For this role you will be situated within the product team who are looking to scale their early stage white-labelled B2B SaaS products.

As well as being a hands on leader who thrives on innovation and developing meaningful products, you will be responsible for leading the technical decisions, architecture, assisting with product development and overall strategic technical decision making.

For now think of the break down of the role to be:
  • 25% Product and technical strategy
  • 25% Architecture and solutions
  • 50% Hands on development
The tech stack:
The current tech is built in PHP, Laravel, React and AWS. Whilst this specific tech stack is important to know your way around, we are seeking a leader who has knowledge and experience across various tech stacks.

Above and beyond that they would love to see you have skills and experience with:
  • Experience with user authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
  • Strong experience with API development/integration
  • Understanding of MVC design patterns
  • You have a background in PHP (Laravel) and ideally React
  • Experience working with SQL databases and their declarative query languages
  • Strong understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • Knowledge of best practice risk, testing and security
  • Work effectively and collaboratively in a cross-functional team across design and product management
  • Knowledge of object oriented programming within PHP
  • Experience developing responsive web app experiences
About you:
  • Strong visual and verbal communication, competent written communication
  • You have experience with automated testing and supporting the software you build
  • You have an ability to communicate complex ideas and concepts simply and clearly
  • environments where they are hands on in defining best practices rather than just following!
  • Able to self-manage day to day, whilst working closely with the product manager to coordinate broader workflow
  • Keeps up to date with the latest thinking and technologies relating to digital product development
  • Previous experience working in a start-up / scalep-up product environment is helpful, but really we are looking for someone who is a problem solver and used to working in
Whats on offer to you:
  • Meaningful work which is dramatically changing the education space
  • A truly diverse company with a wide variety of amazing brains to leverage off of
  • A culture which values an open mind to new ideas and approaches
  • Working in an ethical and ‘do no harm’ environment
  • An experiment led team environment
  • A supportive, flexible work culture
Keen to learn more?
Hey- we’re affix. We have the amazing job of partnering with inspiring companies such as Curio to help them scale up their teams with the addition of great humans. We would love to know more about you, what you’re passionate about, interests and hobbies that goes beyond just reviewing your CV. So, let's have a chat and see if this is your happy (work) place.

Contact either of us on:
Alexandra Post:
0423 344 956
Alexandra.post@affix.com.au

Breanna Skeen:
0410 915 595
Breanna.skeen@affix.com.au

content_html:
Web Developer responsibilities include:

  • Writing well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
  • Creating website layout/user interfaces by using standard HTML/CSS practices
  • Integrating data from various back-end services and databases

Job brief
We are looking for an outstanding Web Developer to be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of our website.

Web Developer Job Duties

Web developer responsibilities include building our website from concept all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layout and function.

Responsibilities

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices
  • Create website layout/user interface by using standard HTML/CSS practices
  • Integrate data from various back-end services and databases
  • Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs
  • Create and maintain software documentation
  • Be responsibile for maintaining, expanding, and scaling our site
  • Stay plugged into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities
  • Cooperate with web designers to match visual design intent

Requirements

  • Proven working experience in web programming
  • Top-notch programming skills and in-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSS
  • Familiarity with at least one of the following programming languages: PHP, ASP.NET, Javascript or Ruby on Rails
  • A solid understanding of how web applications work including security, session management, and best development practices
  • Adequate knowledge of relational database systems, Object Oriented Programming and web application development
  • Hands-on experience with network diagnostics, network analytics tools
  • Basic knowledge of Search Engine Optimization process
  • Aggressive problem diagnosis and creative problem solving skills
  • Strong organizational skills to juggle multiple tasks within the constraints of timelines and budgets with business acumen
  • Ability to work and thrive in a fast-paced environment, learn rapidly and master diverse web technologies and techniques.
  • BS in computer science or a related field

If this sounds like you please submit your resume and remuneration expectations.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Work Eligibility:

  • The candidate can work permanently with no restriction on hours (Preferred)

Work Remotely:

  • Yes

• Multi skilled in both electrical and mechanical disciplines
  • Formal trade qualification as Fitter/Turner with REL (D-Class), or
  • A-Class Electrical including hands-on experience in a maintenance focussed role,
  • Experience of planned preventative maintenance systems
  • Experience fault finding within MHE/Automation systems
  • Ability to read and understand mechanical and electrical drawings
  • Basic workshop skills
  • Experience of conveyor maintenance, motor controllers/inverters
  • Experience of working to appropriate health & safety standards and regulations
  • Experience of contractor management
  • Ability to work shifts in a 24/7 environment

Here at Amazon we are looking to hire an experienced Maintenance Technician to join the team in one of our highly automated and fast paced Fulfilment Centers (FC).

Purpose of the Job:
The focus of the Maintenance Technician role is to ensure safety regulations and policies are adhered to, to ensure preventative maintenance is conducted on time to a high standard and to provide high levels of equipment availability through continuous improvement.

Responsibilities
  • Put health & safety best practices first in all work carried out.
  • Carry out planned preventative maintenance on the full range of equipment within the site.
  • React quickly to breakdowns, communicate clearly with affected parties and work efficiently to fix the issue.
  • Support continuous improvement by learning from breakdowns and sending feedback and suggestions for improvements through the line manager.
  • Provide high levels of equipment availability to our internal customers.
  • Support and learn from Senior Maintenance Technicians.

  • Experience of high voltage switching
  • Experience of sortation machines
  • Experience of maintaining/configuring bar code scanners
  • Experience of print and apply machines

Please note Amazon does not sponsor for immigration for this role.

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

content_html:
• Exciting opportunity for someone looking to step-up in their career & work closely with a CTO
  • Work on an industry leading SaaS Cloud Product
  • Based in Cremorne
Our client is a product startup in the utilities space. They provide an end-to-end operations and infrastructure platform for embedded network & mid-market customers. Whilst mid-market players have been their sweet spot & market fit to date, their continued success and the serious commercial benefits of their product has allowed them to now support their clients to scale to mass-market levels… and even chase some of the bigger players.

Alongside supporting this growth and working on their product roadmap, they have some pretty awesome project work in the pipeline. They are scaling their local development team in Melbourne & are looking for an ambitious Midweight Java Developer to join them.

More about the role

This role is going to be instrumental in fulfilling the company’s growth plans and delivering to key projects. We are looking for a developer who has skills, or knowledge and interest, across their tech stack:
  • Java 1.8 - with the view to move to version 12+
  • Spring framework, Hibernate ORM, & web services framework
  • Angular 8.2
  • Cloud - their application is currently running on AWS and they are looking to utilise more of the components such as Lambda, Aurora, Elastic Cache
  • Database - they are currently using MySQL running in AWS RDS but they are migrating this to AWS Aurora in the next 3-4 months period.
  • Serverless architecture
  • Testing - They follow TDD methodology using JUnit
Please don’t worry if you don’t tick all the boxes. If you have solid development skills in Java & have a keen interest in learning the rest, we would still love to chat.

More about you
  • You have 3-4 years of Java development experience - Spring, Hibernate, Web Services and API development
  • You have experience with automated testing (JUnit, Selenium)
  • You have a growth mindset - it’s all about your attitude
  • You have great communication skills, a positive ‘can do’ attitude and a team-oriented mindset
  • Exposure to cloud services (AWS) would be preferable
  • Bonus points if you have experience with serverless architecture
  • Open to learning other languages and frameworks that support our technical direction
Whats on offer for you

You’ll be working on an industry leading SaaS cloud product. This is an opportunity for you to work closely with & learn from the CTO/Founder as you support them to scale the product. This is an invitation for you to craft your career & develop into their next senior on the team.
  • A company who seriously believes in tech & automation
  • An environment where you can learn & work across the entire product, tech stack & system
  • A team that has an open mind to new tooling, ideas, & approaches
  • A supportive, flexible work culture
Next steps:

Hey - I’m Kushla! If you are interested to have a chat please apply by sending through your CV to this ad. :-)

For any questions - kushla.egan@affix.com.au or 0413 284 264

We’re affix. We have the amazing job to partner with inspiring companies to help them scale up their teams with the addition of great humans. We would love to know more about you, what you’re passionate about, interests and hobbies that goes beyond just reviewing your CV. So, let's have a chat and see if this is your happy (work) place.

content_html:
Company Description

Inlogik Pty Ltd, an Australian owned and run company, has since grown to become a leader in premier spend analysis tools and expense management solutions, serving clients located in over 24 countries around the globe. Inlogik operates out of offices in Melbourne, Sydney, London and New York. Inlogik has over 14,000 organisations using its software including over 20 of the top 200 Australian Companies.


Job Description

We are looking for Software Developers (either with prior experience or wanting to pick up skills using C#, .Net, NodeJS, ReactJS) wanting to join a collaborative and supportive team, building complex SAAS solutions.

As an example, your day at Inlogik may include:

  • Participating in solution design, development and testing activities.
  • Collaborating with team members ensuring delivery is met.
  • Upskilling, Continuous Learning – for career and personal development.
  • Participation with networking, dev days, hackathons, etc.
  • And more….


To be considered, you will be able to demonstrate:

  • Understanding or having prior experience working with C#, .NET and or other Development tools.
  • Knowledge or have prior experience with NodeJS or ReactJS.
  • Sound analytical, design and problem-solving skills.
  • Positive, proactive team player with the ability to work independently under minimum supervision.
  • Your ability to communicate technical concepts concisely and effectively.
  • The desire to increase knowledge and skills when circumstances call for additional learning.


This is an opportunity to work with great people, a company that embraces technology and be provided with:

  • The tools needed / required and more.
  • The ability to gain professional development to improve your technical knowledge
  • The opportunity in joining a team that provides support, mentoring and guidance.
  • A rewarding competitive salary package.
  • Flexibility and Work Balance lifestyle.
  • A whole lot more, especially if self-development is a focus.


Then please send through your latest resume with best contact details and if you have a GitHub or Project Portfolio please share and we will be in touch.


Qualifications

null

Additional Information

Joining Inlogik on a permanent full time position you will be exposed to a number of benefits that may include:

  • An opportunity to be noticed.
  • Joining a supportive, collaborative team environment.
  • Training and being coached on new testing tools and frameworks.
  • Career progression
  • Participation in regular Company Social Events.
  • Team lunch dates and more.

content_html:
We're looking for a UI/UX lead who can lead from the front as a developer and UI designer; inspiring other team members in the Front end space

The Company
An innovative Technology company who are based in Melbourne's Inner Eastern suburbs are seeking a UI/UX Development lead to join their agile technology team.
You will have the opportunity to work extensively with the Software Development Manager as you help this business improve the design and userability of their Front-end applications. This role encompasses both hands-on Front-end development as well as getting involved in UI design.
From a coding perspective, you will be expected to use Vue.JS in the role although we are open to applicants who come from an Angular 2+ or React.JS background. Outside of Vue, you will also get the opportunity to learn and use Flutter in the role which will be great for your career moving forward.
In total, the business you will be joining have around a dozen Software Engineers but you will be the in-house Front-end specialist. Prior to COVID, this business were renowed for having great work-life balance policies, so that is another benefit to consider too.
We are looking for established Front-end Engineers only for this position.
Your Profile
Reporting to the SDM, you will be a Senior Front-end developer working in a culture of providing simple solutions with clean, scalable and testable code.

You will have:
Experience across the SDLC, having worked in commercial environments for at least six years
Experience with Vue.JS or React or Angular 2.0+
A strategic vision, able to set direction and define the Front-end strategy
A flair for UI Design
A great attitude and willingness to wear 'different hats' within the organisation
Valid Australian working rights - permanent residency minimum requirement
Apply Now
If you are interested in this opportunity please do not hesitate to apply ASAP. You can send your resume via the link or you can email me directly on luke.edmunds@roberthalf.com.au.
I look forward to hearing from you.

content_html:
Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro

You & your new role

Our team is seeking an experienced Senior Analyst Engineer to be part of its growing technology team. This will be a hands-on leading role that will provide software engineering and IT Operation services to meet Enterprise Lending requirements.

Design, develop and maintain the ecosystem of applications software, services and microservices, built the Lending Platform


Core Responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:

  • Designing, coding, testing and deploying backend applications or services either in one major language, or a range of programs/microservices across multiple platforms predominantly in cloud environments.
  • Support: Documentation of application/service design, operations procedures and knowledge management
  • Collaborating with business and technology teams to evaluate, integrate IT applications/services or provision of service and infrastructure to meet business objectives
  • Ensuring that systems/services are developed within agreed budgets and time frames meeting design requirements, security standards, compliance and control requirements
  • Providing technical mentoring, coaching and guidance to team members.

What skills/experience do I need to be successful in the role?

  • Experience in AWS or other cloud infrastructure platform and services.
  • Advanced skills in one or more of the major programming languages (Java, JavaScript, Node.js).
  • Experience in developing APIs or microservices.
  • Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment.
  • Developing test cases and test automation.
  • Advanced skills and knowledge of one or more of the databases (relational and non-relational) such as SQL, NoSQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, DynamoDB.
  • Experience in open source programming (Scripting Languages, Python etc.).
  • Knowledge in Home Lending & Business Lending Financials will be valuable.
  • Stakeholder Management in a dynamic changing environment.
  • Working in collaborative, enterprise, and agile environments and supporting tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence, SharePoint)
  • Excellent time and resource management.

We offer:

  • Fast paced environment, with leading edge technology and innovation
  • Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing
  • Salary confirming to market standards
  • Flexible working policy

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing sector of the banking industry with many new applications and projects on the horizon.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status.

Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the advert.

We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.
content_text:
Work type: Permanent Full time
Location: Aust - VIC Metro

You & your new role

Our team is seeking an experienced Senior Analyst Engineer to be part of its growing technology team. This will be a hands-on leading role that will provide software engineering and IT Operation services to meet Enterprise Lending requirements.

Design, develop and maintain the ecosystem of applications software, services and microservices, built the Lending Platform


Core Responsibilities of the role include but are not limited to:

Designing, coding, testing and deploying backend applications or services either in one major language, or a range of programs/microservices across multiple platforms predominantly in cloud environments.
Support: Documentation of application/service design, operations procedures and knowledge management
Collaborating with business and technology teams to evaluate, integrate IT applications/services or provision of service and infrastructure to meet business objectives
Ensuring that systems/services are developed within agreed budgets and time frames meeting design requirements, security standards, compliance and control requirements
Providing technical mentoring, coaching and guidance to team members.


What skills/experience do I need to be successful in the role?

Experience in AWS or other cloud infrastructure platform and services.
Advanced skills in one or more of the major programming languages (Java, JavaScript, Node.js).
Experience in developing APIs or microservices.
Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment.
Developing test cases and test automation.
Advanced skills and knowledge of one or more of the databases (relational and non-relational) such as SQL, NoSQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, DynamoDB.
Experience in open source programming (Scripting Languages, Python etc.).
Knowledge in Home Lending & Business Lending Financials will be valuable.
Stakeholder Management in a dynamic changing environment.
Working in collaborative, enterprise, and agile environments and supporting tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence, SharePoint)
Excellent time and resource management.


We offer:

Fast paced environment, with leading edge technology and innovation
Work in a collaborative environment with highly talented and motivated colleagues that are passionate about knowledge sharing
Salary confirming to market standards
Flexible working policy

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing sector of the banking industry with many new applications and projects on the horizon.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status.

Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the advert.

We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

Leading Digital Agency Exciting New Projects using latest Technology

  • Port Melbourne location – short tram ride from CBD
  • Comfortable spacious offices with parking
  • Work and learn from a global agency offices in USA, Europe & Israel Due to growth, there is an opportunity for an experienced web developer/programmer who can work with Magento e-commerce platform & WordPress CMS. This individual must have the passion, initiative and a ‘can-do approach’, the ability to confidently liaise with clients where necessary and most importantly love what your doing! It is imperative that you will bring excellent user interface development skills including good knowledge of the latest web technologies including browser/device dependencies & best practices. You will be working in the most innovative and expert stage with people that understand the internet know how business and have over 11 years of experience. We encourage our staff to keep updated with the latest knowledge in the industry and believe in the development and growth of all of our staff members.

The successful candidate must have;

  • Excellent knowledge of HTML5/CSS/Javascript/JQuery
  • MUST have solid experience working with Magento e-commerce platform & WordPress CMS
  • Experienced and general knowledge of MySQL & PHP
  • Previous experience in a similar role or working with technologies listed above
  • Experience on E-commerce platforms Please note, candidates with exposure to various Open Source web platforms and API’s will be preferred. If you want to start a career with one of Melbourne’s leading agencies in a role that will provide career development and a chance to be part of a great team – apply today.

• Full Stack Developer - GAE / Python
  • Google App Engine & Python - Permanent role
  • North western suburbs - Cambellfield VIC
Altitude is seeking an experienced Developer with Google App Engine & Python for a permanent position in Melbourne. This large global organisation is based in the North West of Melbourne - Campbellfield VIC.

This Full Stack Developer will lead and lift the team’s technical capability for a software solution based on the Google App Engine. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team that’s responsible for the full software development life cycle, from concept to deployment.

Required skills:
  • Experience with Google App Engine is mandatory
  • Prior experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar roles
  • Experience developing desktop and mobile applications
  • Experience with React JS for Front End Technology
  • Experience with Python for Back End Technology
  • Unrestricted work rights in Australia.
Desired skills:
  • Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
  • Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)
  • Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design
How to apply:

Please apply using the link and call Damian on 03 8609 1228 for a chat.

Based on the volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted initially. All applicants will be notified when the role is closed.

May 5, 2020

At Precision Sourcing we have partnered once again with a leading business and have an urgent requirement for an ESRI GIS Developer.

About you:

  • Experience working as a GIS developer for web-based applications.
  • Experience with ESRI ArcGIS platform tools, ArcGIS full product suite including
    • ArcGIS for Enterprise (Server and Portal)
    • ArcGIS Database SDE Layer
    • ArcGIS Desktop (Arc Map and Pro)
    • ArcGIS Java script API
    • Web App Builder and building custom widgets
    • Working with ArcGIS Python libraries (ArcPy)
    • Geoprocessing services
    • ArcGIS Online, web maps creation, mapping services and publishing services
  • RESTful Services integration to ArcGIS.
  • Databases such as Amazon RDS MySQL, PostgreSQL, MS SQL server etc.
  • PL/SQL development in PostGIS.
  • Knowledge of code versioning and software development lifecycle tools such as Bitbucket, JIRA, Jenkins.

Desired Additional Skills

  • Proficient using JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as Angular, React JS etc.
  • UX/UI design.
  • Visualization tools like Power BI.
  • Working with GoForms, GoCanvas, or Cognito forms etc.
  • Integration platform such as Zapier, Microsoft Flow or MuleSoft ESB.
  • API design and development.

This is a Sydney based contract and offering an immediate start.For more details please do not hesitate to contact Karen on 0451 455 885. Please click below to apply or email

content_html:
• High school certificate
  • 18 years or older
  • Experience with Microsoft Office
  • Ability to work full time in shifts
  • Able to start July 2020

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is growing rapidly, and we are looking for a Data Center Technicians to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team as part of our Work-Based Learning Program (WBLP). Amazon has multiple WBLP trainee openings, and will start all technicians in July 2020. These trainees will participate in our 12-week work and training program in our Sydney Data Centers.

Responsibilities:
The position will help ensure overall availability and reliability for our customers within our Data Centers. This position involves installing new rack equipment, decommissioning existing racks, repairing and diagnosing broken servers, handling computer equipment and parts, and managing network gear during installation, decommissioning, and repair.

All candidates should be willing to work both independently and with a team. Work prioritization, organizational skills, effective communication, and the ability to react quickly are critical to being successful.

Physical Requirements:
  • Walk, use hands and fingers, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch. Work at heights and from ladders.
  • Continuously climb and descend stairs safely (applies to sites with stairs).
  • Reach and stretch to position equipment and fixtures while maintaining balance.
  • Push or pull heavy objects into position.
  • Daily travel between sites may be required.
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time.

  • Familiarity with computer hardware components and operating systems
  • Ability to manage work and priorities through a ticketing system and coordination with Manager
  • Has taken STEM or vocational course curriculum
  • Driver’s License
  • Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
  • Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Magento Developer [Full Time] – Available


About the Role

This full-time role will see you working out of Silverwater, just minutes from the Parramatta CBD, and with a young and enthusiastic team who are willing to push boundaries and think outside the [gear] box!

As our Magento Developer, you will be a cross-functional developer working to directly implement new features and improvements across our growing business. You will be involved with projects from start to finish as well as the ongoing improvement of the finished product.

Required Skills and Attributes:

Must be a certified Magento Developer
Previous experience with E-Commerce Systems and Websites
Previous experience with WordPress
Excellent understanding of SEO and web performance
3 – 5 years’ experience with complex Magento and PHP projects
PHP coding, SQL administration and optimization, and Unix/Linux or Windows server administration is key
Proficient with the following – JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON, PHP
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving capabilities
Strong knowledge of Magento Best Practices, including experience developing custom extensions and extending third party extensions
Solid understanding of Object-oriented Programming (OOP)
Creative and have a ‘can-do’ attitude

What we will offer you:

Attractive salary package
Be a part of a dedicated, young and driven team
Excellent staff perks and discounts on all our products

If this sounds like the position for you, please apply by clicking on the button provided and attach an updated version of your resume with your portfolio of work in relation to eCommerce websites.

content_html:
Cloud Networking Services
Staff Network Engineer - IRAP



What you get to do in this role:

As a Staff Network Engineer on the Cloud Networking team, you will be responsible for building, managing and operating the global network infrastructure that is the foundation of all our services. Maintaining network stability ensures that our customers stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

Key to success for this role will be your understanding of the network and using your knowledge and skills in delivering against our goals. The role itself is a combination of deployments, sustainment engineering, and operational (troubleshooting, problem analysis, etc.) tasks and allows for the engineer to be involved in a broad range of network functions. Excellent cross-team collaboration, technical skills, and clear communications are required.

It is a requirement of this position that the successful candidate must be an Australian Citizen and currently hold or able to obtain a minimum Baseline Security Clearance.

Primary roles and responsibilities are as follows:

  • Design and deploy networks based on business and technical requirements.
  • Partner with project and program managers to meet overall timelines and resolution of issues.
  • Operate and troubleshoot networks to identify and resolve issues quickly.
  • Take a lead role in the engagement and mitigation of outage causing events or issues.
  • Validate problem descriptions and perform detailed problem diagnosis; track and update problems in trouble-ticketing system.
  • Perform non-critical investigations into functionality that is not working as desired.
  • Engage deeply in the sustainment function to proactively analyze network parameters such as capacity and availability to ensure issues are fixed before they cause an outage.
  • Review, consult and prepare for planned change introduction to production environment.
  • Participate in rotating “on call” schedule with other members of the team including weekends.
  • Partner with teams to plan and execute software code upgrades and device maintenance.
  • Partner with the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team to provide mentorship and input on operational process improvements.
  • Provide feedback to infrastructure architects on design issues or improvements and input into the design process for new initiatives.


Sample first 6-month deliverables

  • Quickly integrate into the environment and gain a solid understanding of network architecture, organization, and process/procedures.
  • Deploy capacity into a datacenter based on demand.
  • Participate in incident bridges and serve as the networking engineering resource to troubleshoot and mitigate outages.
  • Take ownership of a minimum of two datacenters perform all sustainment engineering functions.
  • Partner with the SRE team to identify and solve one network process issue.


In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:

The candidate should have a solid foundation in networking including routing, switching, security and load balancing. The following is a list of requirements for this role:

  • 2+ years of experience with cloud computing technologies (e.g. Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, etc.) across Windows and/or Linux
  • Azure Core Platform: Compute, Storage, Networking.
  • Azure Web Apps: developing, deploying, debugging and supporting web applications using .NET, Java, PHP, Python, Node.js etc. on Windows or Linux.
  • Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): using DevOps, Bit Bucket, GitHub.
  • Experience in one or more automation languages (PowerShell, shell scripts, Perl, Python, Ansible, Terraform) desired.
  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in working on Internet and data center networks.
  • Possess a solid understanding of and have experience with most of the following network technologies: BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, HSRP/VRRP, IPSEC, SNMP.
  • Deep, hands-on experience with TCP/IP protocols including capturing and analyzing traffic with Wireshark and/or other tools.
  • Familiarity with Cisco IOS and JunOS operating systems required.
  • F5 and Cisco ASA knowledge and experience strongly desired.
  • Experience with network monitoring applications such as EMC Watch4Net, Cacti, Splunk is a plus.
  • Ability to partner with peers who are globally distributed is a key part of this role.
  • Passion for customer experiences and focus on delivering high quality support.
  • Strong communication skills and empathy for customers.
  • Ability to learn new technology in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity.

We are looking for a React Native Developer to join our FinTech client in Sydney for a 6 month contract with a view to extend. You will be working on a green field project that has just started and we are looking for someone to start as soon as possible.

content_html:
We’re a global business, building diverse brands and touching lives all over the world with our products. But that doesn’t stop us caring as much about the sustainability of our business as we do the success of our brands and our people. Together we can feel good about the work we do every day. Surrounded by inspiring leaders and supportive peers, you’ll work with purpose in an inclusive and diverse culture, bringing fresh ideas and simply being you! Please note this is a 12 month contract opportunity

About the Role:

The MPS Planner at our Minto factory is responsible for scheduling a portfolio of raw and packaging materials involved in the processes for making our delicious ice-cream Streets brands such as Cornetto, GayTime & Magnum.

Reporting into the Planning Manager your responsibilities will include:

  • Balance the requirements of customer service, inventory and supplier costs to deliver targets
  • React quickly to changes in actual sales, the sales forecast and supplier delivery dates
  • Highlight risks and develop contingencies to ensure production plan and customer service levels are maintained
  • Coordinate supply chain activities related to new product launch and deletion; identify constraints and highlighting potential risks
  • Build strong relationships with Factory, Production Planners, Buying, Warehouse and other parts of the Supply Chain team. Leverage these relationships to improve the quality and robustness of supply plans that assist in business decisions
  • Work with factories and key suppliers to resolve operational supply chain issues
  • Continually search for opportunities to improve reliability and responsiveness
  • Maintain the data integrity of the material planning systems

To be successful you will have:

  • Previous experience in a supply chain function/ team, ideally within a planning team
  • Excellent numerical skills including analysis
  • Advanced Excel skills and SAP would be advantageous
  • Critical thinking and problem solving
  • Excellent people skills – with the ability to communicate with a variety of stakeholder interactions

You will be joining a company where making a positive impact is our mission. We value and embrace our inclusive and diverse culture where individuality is celebrated. We want everyone to bring their ‘Whole Self’ and this includes you. #uniquelyunilever”

If you have any questions about the opportunity or your application please send an email to our Talent team at ANZ.Talent@Unilever.com

• Incredible Opportunity to be a part of a historic Remediation Project
  • Well paid assignment - 6 month Contract
  • Sydney CBD based (Currently-Work From Home)


A fantastic opportunity has arisen for multiple Processing Associates - Banking & Lending to join a large scale remediation project in a leading Australian Multinational Bank.

The positions operate in a dynamic environment and are well suited to those with strong processing skills and a positive, ‘can do” attitude.

We're preferring candidates have a strong Banking, Finance, Lending and/or Regulatory understanding + interest.

  • You don't need to have experience, you just need to be able to express the knowledge to us in our interview.

Candidates must also be willing to work flexible and varying shifts through the year and also must react positively, patiently and effectively to calls seeking clarifications.

What you'll be doing:
  • To be able to work well on high volume Commercial & Equipment Finance requests sent by multiple channels
  • Internal coordination: Emailing, back-end tasks, some data entry, administrative duties.
  • To be quick and detailed in interpreting the request of the customer
  • Conducting yourself with a customer-first focused approach
  • Be able to solve problems & resolve issues individually, and escalate when/if necessary
What you'll bring to the role:
  • Excellent Communication skills
  • Strong Understanding of Banking and Lending Operations
  • Strong Understanding of regulatory compliance
  • Relationship management ability with internal customers
  • Quick Learner, Energetic & Self Starter
  • Customer First approach
Looking forward to your application!

content_html:
Job Title: Sr. Software QA Engineer
Location(s): Sydney, Australia.

This position reports to: Sr. Manager, Engineering Program Management

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before.


ServiceNow has been named as the most innovative company in the world by Forbes. We are the leading enterprise cloud. Our SaaS solutions generate revenue of ~$2B annually, and we are still growing over 30% YOY. We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.


What you get to do in this role:
  • Work with developers to document validation of software products through the use of systematic tests
  • Develop, apply, and maintain quality standards for company products
  • Analyze products and write test standards and procedures. Develops and modifies software test plans
  • Maintains documentation of test cases to assist in debugging and modification of software
  • Analyzes existing test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action
  • Provides feedback in preparation of technical appraisals of programming languages, systems, and computation software.

In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
  • Software development / engineering experience
  • Ability to read and comprehend source code
  • Understands common software design patterns
  • Demonstrated experience working with developers across multiple product teams
  • Excellent technical writing abilities
  • Prior experience preferred working with QE/QA environments and teams
  • Preferred language experience:
    • JavaScript
    • Java
    • Python


NOTE: Due to the nature of work related to this position, employee will be required to obtain a Federal Government Clearance. The minimum requirement to obtain this clearance is to be an Australia citizen.
We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

job_title: Project Engineer | Structures experience essential | Sydney
content_html:
• Base to $140k
  • Top tier contractor
  • Opportunity to step to SPE



Are you a civil Project Engineer who wants to join a highly regarded major civil contractor who will give you the experience managing your own section of works?


Our client is seeking the expertise and skills of a Project Engineer to work on structures projects in Sydney area on a major civil project that they have recently won. The project will go for the next year up to four years and will keep you employed in Sydney going forward with this East Coast civil contractor.


This civil contractor is a well established major civil construction business employing people across the country with over $300m worth of present projects. With a strong focus on civil engineering, our client maintains its diversity through their involvement in other projects such as bridges, ports, structures, roads, marine and rail.


Our client is looking for a dedicated individual with previous structures, bridgeworks and complex civil infrastructure experience to work on a project with an emphasis on complex civil structural works, this is a rare opportunity not to be missed. The project will see you secure, with several years worth of work and you will have guaranteed further employment with the client.


Not only will you be joining an award-winning contractor but you will also form part of a talented, professional team of individuals. This exciting opportunity would ideally suit an engineer who has had previous exposure to bridges, ports, structures and complex civil projects.


To be considered for this role it is vital that you have the following skills:


  • A Bachelor in Civil Engineering or equivalent
  • Worked on civil projects worth over $5m in value
  • Previously worked on major structures or bridge projects
  • Strong leadership skills
  • High level of organisation
  • Be able to work and communicate as part of a team
  • Exceptional understanding of OH&S policies
  • Ability to think and react quickly to any difficulties which may arise in the workplace



If you have the relevant experience and are looking to build your career to that next level than you need look no further.


To be considered for the role please forward your resume to Derek King at civil@constructability.com.au

To be considered for this role it is vital that you have the following skills:


A Bachelor in Civil Engineering or equivalent
Worked on civil projects worth over $5m in value
Previously worked on major structures or bridge projects
Strong leadership skills
High level of organisation
Be able to work and communicate as part of a team
Exceptional understanding of OH&S policies
Ability to think and react quickly to any difficulties which may arise in the workplace


If you have the relevant experience and are looking to build your career to that next level than you need look no further.


To be considered for the role please forward your resume to Derek King at civil@constructability.com.au

content_html:
• Ability to take ownership
  • Excellent Perks
  • New and Innovative Tech-Stack

Lead Engineer - Award Winning Start Up

Unique opportunity with an award winning start up who focus on the collection and application of data insights.
As the tech lead, you will be given responsibility to help create and drive the technical road map, as well as influence key decisions.

You will be working with both the web and mobile platform, and given full autonomy to build and develop the solutions you have created.

This opportunity will allow you to get your hands dirty with the latest and greatest tech, as well as allowing you to influence change in the tech stack.

You will have the opportunity to interact with numerous business stake holders as well as lead and help grow the tech team.

The tech stack currently in place includes Kotlin, AWS and React.

To be consider you must have:
Strong development knowledge
5+ years commercial experience with software development(Java/Kotlin preferred)
A willingness to lead from the front

Benefits for you -
Competitive packages
Opportunity to influence an exciting start up
Yearly retreats, quarterly off site events

content_html:
.Net Developer - CAMPBELLTOWN


We are currently working with a great Technology Company specialising in providing Data, Cloud Computing and Software Development Services, and Solutions to a range of different businesses and industries across Australia, New Zealand, and the UK.


Due to their continued success, they are now looking to add another .NET developer to their team.


The .NET developer will have a minimum of 2 years’ experience in a .NET position, who is looking to take the next major step in their career. The successful candidate will be joining a busy and experienced team with lots of new, exciting projects to work on, allowing you to hit the ground running working on interesting and challenging projects. The primary purpose of the .NET developer role will be the development and maintenance of web applications that underpin many of the operational processes that contribute to the business’s overall success.


Key Requirements
  • Must know: ASP.Net/C#/VB
  • MVC 5.0+ / MVVM
  • SQL 2008+ Knowledge and experienced
  • HTML/CSS/JS – not an expert but enough to get out of trouble
  • Experience with TFS/Git
  • Angular.Js
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication and organisation skills
  • The ability to work autonomously
Advantageous skills, the below are extremely beneficial;
  • Educated to a degree level or higher
  • Experience with the Entity framework or other ORM frameworks
  • Azure web application hosting experience or knowledge
  • Experience of working in an Agile environment


This is an immediate need and on offer is a competitive salary, ongoing training and development, and real career progression.

content_html:
Senior SEO & Web Analytics Specialist – Market Management | NSW – Sydney
Allianz is the home for Senior SEO & web analytics specialist's who dare to develop and drive excellence in platform and website performance.
Want to be trusted to do what's right for the customer?
Allianz Australia Digital first strategy is the singular transition of offline Insurance sales and service to an online environment that delivers market leading digital experiences through contemporary UI and UX experiences.
The Digital marketing team are driving this strategy in parallel to a broader companywide transformation. This includes moving to the Adobe marketing stack using a global style guide, and setting the blueprint for the rest of the market on the “how”.
The Senior SEO & Web Analytics Specialist will report directly into the Senior Manager, Digital Media and is a permanent role based in our Sydney CBD offices.
The position holder works closely with peers across the Allianz Digital team to test and analyse platform and website performance. You will develop key recommendations for platform and website optimisation that ultimately delivers a return in investment for the business.
You will oversee deliverables from the SEO agency and drive growth of organic search visibility. You will ensure ongoing accurate measurement of website activity via dashboards, gathering insights and recommending changes to drive ongoing website improvements.
The role will play a key part in interacting with the business and will attend fortnightly sales meeting with key divisions to inform development.

In addition You'll be responsible for:
  • Oversee technical and content recommendations from our SEO agency and liaise with relevant product managers through to implementation.
  • Build content and optimisation plans for all products and ensure the agency provides relevant technical and copywriting support.
  • Maintain and configure the web analytics tools and processes utilised across the Allianz Digital teams to measure and monitor platform performance
  • Project manage the implementation of advanced event tracking as new pages and content is introduced across all Allianz platforms.
  • Monitor and report on the effectiveness of paid and earned media channels for Allianz Australia, including social media, and partner with relevant teams (e.g., Social Media, Direct Marketing and Consumer Marketing) to identify and pursue opportunities for optimisation
  • Ensure that web analytics reporting is integrated into the Market Management reporting suite, working closely with the Customer & Insights team
  • Initiate new ideas to further improve website, navigation, site speed and content on all sites in addition to identifying best practice SEO and internal search improvements
  • Leverage analytics to drive web development and optimisation efforts and to develop customer experience insights
Important to your success: .

  • Experience in using Excel and web analytical tools: Google analytics AND/OR Adobe Audience Manager
  • Good understanding of web technologies like HTML, JavaScript, server-side scripting, web servers, log files, etc.
  • Strong communication & presentation skills with the ability to work under pressure.
  • Previous skills in working with multiple websites as well as key SEO/ SEM best practice knowledge
What's on offer?

  • What matters to you, matters to us too. Feel supported to have open, honest conversations about the flex you need so that you're able to take care of your personal life
  • Be a part of a business under change & transformation – make a difference!
  • Company discounts & benefits
About us
Allianz is the home for those who dare – a supportive place where you can take the initiative to grow and to actively strengthen our global leadership position. By truly caring about people, we foster a culture where our employees are empowered to collaborate, perform, embrace trends and dare to challenge the industry.
Allianz is committed to enabling a culture where inclusion is embedded, everyone belongs and new ideas are embraced. We welcome and value talent from all backgrounds, experiences and ways of working Please advise us if you require any reasonable adjustments to fully participate in the recruitment process or perform the requirements of the role.
If you dare, there's an opportunity for you at www.allianz.com.au/careers
#LI-AllianzAu

content_html:
• Surry Hills high growth Tech Company
  • Technical QA/SDIT
  • you speak developer

Re-think how you test and what you think testing is for in this role. If you're stuck in a step by step, templated work flow of the ISEB or ISQTB style of thinking - then you are definitely not suited.

We need people who like to think, who are creative, who have fire and passion to work out solutions, who don't just show up on the job doing what they have done before. You don't do 'robotic',you aren't so scripted you can't think or design strategies built from the requirement in front of you.

So if you're saying to yourself "wow, you cow" you get Nothing! GREAT.

BUT, if you back yourself, are incurably curious, excited about new stuff and can hold you're own around motivated, exceptionally smart people, if you are honest and love learning new stuff I'd love to talk with you

Do you ask yourself questions like "How do I know that I know?".

If you know the impact of your reputation on whether the developer thinks your bugs are worth looking at?

If you've stepped back at something you've done and taken real pride in the work you've done..?

If you love it when stuff works and you get a sense of clarity and sanity about how you got stuff sorted...

... and other stuff of this nature. Then there is this role, read below.


Main Activities/Tasks
  • Context driven approach to testing at all times
  • automate the SHI* out of everything (node JS environment)
  • Log clear, reproducible bug reports
  • Advocate for bugs throughout the resolution process
  • advocate for "QA assistance"/ Shift Left paradigms

Technical Expertise

  • Ability to code in Node JS for writing an automated test harness
  • Understand issues, concerns and lay of the land around usability, security, third-party integration, accessibility, performance, load, cross-browser compatibility and mobile devices...
  • Ability to create and define a test approach for any given context
  • A good understanding of metrics and their use in project analysis
  • Ability to write clear bug reports quickly and concisely
Put "wow you cow" in the subject line and email me your resume. Be warned, I bug check your resume for mistakes and whether you have addressed the main requirements. Email Richard@mantechit.com.au

For Australian residents only and you need full Australian working rights.

content_html:
Do you want to become an equity-owning CTO whilst keeping your full time job in the short term?

We're looking for an enthusiastic and experienced technologist to lead our growing tech start-up based in Sydney

About H2X

  • H2X is a SaaS cloud based business that is responsible for the digital transformation that is starting to revolutionise the building services engineering industry
  • We are less than 9 months old and our sales are gaining traction since the completion of our beta phase in January 2020
  • We currently have two streams of revenue which are the users (engineers) and manufacturers who sponsor their products. A third stream of revenue has been identified of which we are working towards monetising
  • We currently have users within Australia, the UK and the USA and are in the sales cycle with four global companies
  • We have a backlog of feature requests from our users and this includes moving across other verticals

About the Position

You will be required to understand and work with the existing code base which has complex algorithms

  • You will need to prepare work for and oversee the output from two remote software developers who have combined experience of around 14 years
  • Architect a highly scalable solution for global customers
  • Potential to go part time and full time in the future

Desired Technical Skills and Experience

  • Experience with full stack development
  • React
  • HTML5 Canvas
  • AWS cloud technology
  • Experience with automated testing
  • Managing a remote team

Desired Soft Skills

To fit into our current team, the following are required to ensure you can fit right in to the culture:

  • Understanding that this is a team game
  • Take initiative to improve the product and direct the team with your expertise
  • Enthusiasm for executing the opportunity
  • Honest and transparent communication with the team

The Offer

  • Equity to be provided in return for unpaid work in line with the rest of the founding team
  • The potential to go part time and full time late 2020
  • Option to invest in shares of the company
  • Flexible work environment

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Commission
